sub_title: Hybrid Geoscientist / Geomodeller | Sales and Consultancy
summary:
I am a structural geologist through academic background with close links to geomechanics, petrophysics and sedimentology. Conducted experimental scientific research (geomechanics) before persuading a career in the geo-energy industry. After being a workflow consultant for 10 years, through working on cross disciplinary geoscience related challenges for customers, I received a solid foundation level of mainly Production Geoscience (static reservoir modeling) related competences and field scale geomodelling. This allows me to combine fundamental Integrated Reservoir Modeling (IRM) concepts supported by a solid tooling background (e.g. Petrel / JewelSuite / Techlog / TNavigator / CMG / Abaqus) and software technology development knowledge (e.g. AGILE project management, digital transformation, technical data management, workflow automation, cloud services, deployment).

Subsurface discipline integration (GP-PP-PG-RE-GM) and understanding for example how modeling uncertainties are propagated from exploration, to appraisal, to field development and finally brownfield production, is something I have been exposed to extensively over the past 10 years. As a static reservoir modeler, I like to use my geological knowledge (independent of tooling) to build scalable models on a selected platform with the latest technology that does the job for the modeling objective and underlying field development concept. I have a good background in static/dynamic model QC workflows and Integrated Reservoir Modeling concepts (e.g. uncertainties - scenario modeling - model framing).

Keywords: Account Management | Marketing | Business Development | Consultancy | Product Development & Delivery | Research | Training

profile_positions.description:
Hybrid (technical sales) geoscientist with main responsibilities to help deploying and providing consulting services to a range of software products for reservoir modelling and geomechanics for conventional, unconventional and energy transition assets.

At different subsurface scales, from the wellbore to the field, I am working with international clients from industries such as oil & gas, geothermal, mining and waste storage on projects and challenges within the field of geomodelling. This can range from traditional jobs such as those associated with field development planning, reservoir production optimization and resource volume estimation, to projects associated with the energy transition (or new energies) such as: carbon storage, hydrogen storage, radioactive waste disposal and the modeling of geothermal plays.
profile_positions.title: Senior Geoscientist

profile_positions.description:
In this job I was exclusively contracted to Shell Global Solutions NL by Petrotechnical Data Systems B.V.

In this role I provide cross disciplinary workflow support across a broad spectrum of the hydrocarbon exploration and production application landscape, specialized in static reservoir modelling workflows using subsurface software tools (e.g. Petrel, JewelSuite). I have been working as a geomodeling consultant on various (10+) projects covering a range of depositional environments and structural styles, but with a focus on projects dealing with clastic reservoirs in extensional tectonic settings (e.g. Nigeria, Brunei, North Sea, Gulf Of Mexico, New Zealand).

Main achievements:

•	Deliver IRM training to client Open University for technical learning programs for SGP/SATP
•	PG project consultancy/short-term assignments of several days/weeks/months covering typical static modeling tasks
•	Provide more ad-hoc workflow support for client global user community – email/teleconference/F2F
•	Tailored reservoir modeling courses taught in Rijswijk, Aberdeen, Moscow, Brunei, Qatar, Lagos, New-Zealand and Bangalore, covering range of topics.

Main strengths:

•	Major competences: resource volume estimation/reservoir geology/structural framework and fracture modelling/property modeling (discrete - continuous)/well planning/PG-PP-RE integration/IRM uncertainty management/static model QC workflows/geostatistics/data management/WRFM
•	Minor competences: time-depth conversion/SI/seismic attribute analysis

As a second task I provided domain support to software developers building proprietary technology for Petrel/JewelSuite and Techlog, herewith bridging the gap between client requirements and the actual software implementation. We work with AGILE methodologies and my main responsibilities are:

•	Business analyst (stakeholder engagement/requirement elicitation)
•	Feature ownership (R&D)
•	Ownership of deployment (documentation/training/consultancy)
profile_positions.title: Geoscientist

profile_positions.description: The goal of this research collaboration project between Shell Global Solutions International B.V. and Utrecht University was to study the petrophysics of (clay-rich) shale rocks in relation to storage of CO2. The results of this work have direct links to implications for caprock integrity and enhancing shale gas production. My tasks include HP/HT experiment design, execution and results publishing. The results of this study have been presented in different conferences, including EGU 2012 (Vienna), GB 2012 (Brussels) and the CMS annual meeting 2013 (Illinois). From the work different scientific publications came forward.
profile_positions.title: PHD Student

profile_positions.description: During this internship, a geomechanical model was constructed in Abaqus software as part of a general integral site investigation assessment study for the potential of CO2 injection in the onshore part of the Gippsland basin, SE Australia. In the model we were able to predict accurately the poro-elastic response or surface uplift due to the injection. The results of this work were presented in Brisbane during the 34th IGC ’12.
profile_positions.title: Junior Geomechanics Advisor

profile_positions.description: As part of my master thesis project I conducted experimental research on clay mineralogy to study the water-assisted weakening mechanisms of minerals in natural fault zones. Some implications of the results are related to studies on shale - water interactions at various scales and the mechanics of seismic events. During the research I worked with various qualitative and quantitative experimental techniques, including FTIR spectroscopy, XRD and TGA.
